item.title: Dragon Crossbow
item.dc:creator: @deadly990 deadly990
item.description:
@deadly990 wrote:

[quote=“Mighty Penguin, post:2, topic:284768”]if(i == 9765) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear"; class8.anIntArray156 = new int[1]; class8.anIntArray160 = new int[1]; class8.anIntArray156[0] = 0; class8.anIntArray160[0] = 0; class8.anInt174 = 13421; class8.anInt181 = 1100; class8.anInt190 = 498; class8.anInt198 = 550; class8.anInt204 = 0; class8.anInt169 = -1; class8.anInt194 = -1; class8.anInt165 = 13422; class8.anInt200 = 13422; class8.anInt164 = -1; class8.anInt188 = -1; class8.aBoolean176 = false; class8.aString170 = "Dragon C'Bow"; class8.aByteArray178 = "A powerful and rare crossbow".getBytes(); }

This code is from God Pure’s source. Its working! (Good job!)[/quote]
pure spoonfeedage, plus you completely showed that you dont know what the ints in an item do.

item.title: Dragon Crossbow
item.dc:creator: @Xion Xion
item.description:
@Xion wrote:

Okay well I was recoloring a Karil’s Crossbow into a Dragon crossbow (changing the colors to dragon) and the item turned into a partyhat… a red partyhat to be exact… The item id is correct because it said dragon crossbow when i put the mouse over it and when i examine it. The recoloring is whats wrong. Heres the code I did. Take a look and please let me know what i did wrong.

if(i == 7811){//item ID
class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear";
class8.anIntArray156 = new int[1];
class8.anIntArray160 = new int [1];
class8.anIntArray156[0] = 10394;
class8.anIntArray160[0] = 926;
class8.anInt174 = 2635;
class8.anInt181 = 440;
class8.anInt190 = 76;
class8.anInt198 = 1850;
class8.anInt204 = 0;
class8.anInt169 = 1;
class8.anInt194 = 1;
class8.anInt165 = 187;
class8.anInt200 = 363;
class8.anInt175 = 29;
class8.anInt197 = 87;
class8.aString170 = "Dragon Crossbow";
class8.aByteArray178 = "A powerful crossbow.".getBytes();//ITEM DESCRIPTION (EXAMINE INFO)
}

Any help please?

Read full topic
